element.name: Slí Slán Amháin by orangetigerprawn, Multi-cache (1.5/3)

long-description.center: This is the first of three multicache based around the Slí na Sláinte routes in Swords. This one follows the Village Slí. The walks are circular routes to be walked in either direction from any starting point.

Similarly, this cache can be started from any waypoint in any order. Find the required information at each waypoint, work out the final coordinates and find the cache. In the spirit of the Slí doing it on foot will do your heart a world of good. This Slí is about 6k long. Finding the cache may be a bit more depending on your starting point.

A handy pdf map of walks can be downloaded
here.
How many windows on the upper floor of the nearest north facing house? E
At this point find a solitary "Kilkenny" number near by. A
The shape of the building matches the shape of the slabs on the ground. How many sides? B
What is the number of the "Mouth Watering" house across the road? C
How many digits are there in the name of the organisation that runs the business on the non residential/recreational corner of this junction? D
Please replace the cache carefully to prevent it from becoming inaccessible.

element.additional-waypoints:
BS218Z1 - Brackenstown Stage
N 53° 27.461 W 006° 13.882
NS218Z1 - North Stage
N 53° 27.834 W 006° 12.995
RS218Z1 - Rathbeal Stage
N 53° 28.015 W 006° 14.315
WS218Z1 - Wells Stage
N 53° 27.353 W 006° 13.315

ul.li:
2010-04-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fjon
Tricky one - needed owner's help with one stage. Was half expecting not to find the cache at the end, but reached down and there it was!

2009-12-31T20:00:00Z : Found it by theswerve
found ok on a quick visit to Swords....TFTC...

2009-12-10T20:00:00Z : Found it by toczygroszek
This time OK! Misunderstood one question, but figured out correctly with owner's help. Thanks for enjoyable walk.

2009-12-07T20:00:00Z : Didn't find it by toczygroszek
Nothing more annoying than "found easily" from previous finder. 3 of 5 questions it was really puzzle for me, didn't really know what should I count... [:(]

2009-12-07T20:00:00Z : Found it by Hezekiah
Found easily - great day for a walkabout! TFTC!

wpt.name: GC218Z1
wpt.desc: Slí Slán Amháin by orangetigerprawn, Multi-cache (1.5/3)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Slí Slán Amháin
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
This is the first of three multicache based around the Slí na Sláinte routes in Swords. This one follows the Village Slí. The walks are circular routes to be walked in either direction from any starting point.


Similarly, this cache can be started from any waypoint in any order. Find the required information at each waypoint, work out the final coordinates and find the cache. In the spirit of the Slí doing it on foot will do your heart a world of good. This Slí is about 6k long. Finding the cache may be a bit more depending on your starting point.

A handy pdf map of walks can be downloaded here.

 


At above coordinates:
How many windows on the upper floor of the nearest north facing house? E
 
Brackenstown Stage: N 53° 27.461 W 006° 13.882
At this point find a solitary "Kilkenny" number near by. A
 
Wells Stage: N 53° 27.353 W 006° 13.315
The shape of the building matches the shape of the slabs on the ground. How many sides? B
 
North Stage: N 53° 27.834 W 006° 12.995
What is the number of the "Mouth Watering" house across the road? C
 
Rathbeal Stage: N 53° 28.015 W 006° 14.315
How many digits are there in the name of the organisation that runs the business on the non residential/recreational corner of this junction? D
 
 
The Cache

Final Location: N 53° 27.(A*2)-(E*(D+C)+B)
W 006° (B+E).(A*D)-(E*(D+C))

Please replace the cache carefully to prevent it from becoming inaccessible.

Additional Waypoints

BS218Z1 - Brackenstown Stage
N 53° 27.461 W 006° 13.882

NS218Z1 - North Stage
N 53° 27.834 W 006° 12.995

RS218Z1 - Rathbeal Stage
N 53° 28.015 W 006° 14.315

WS218Z1 - Wells Stage
N 53° 27.353 W 006° 13.315
